title: 110_hr550
content: The Act titled "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. The Act extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property by updating the years for eligibility. The Act extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property by updating the years for eligibility. Solar lighting equipment, including solar hybrid lighting systems, is now included in the tax credit. The Act extends the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. Solar lighting equipment, including systems using fiber-optic distributed sunlight, is now eligible for the tax credit based on kilowatt capacity. The investment tax credit for solar energy property is extended, including a special rule for solar photovoltaic energy property which provides a $1,500 credit for each half kilowatt of capacity placed in service during the taxable year. The investment tax credit for solar energy property is extended, providing a $1,500 credit for each half kilowatt of capacity of solar photovoltaic energy property placed in service during the taxable year. Special rules apply to rehabilitated or subsidized property. The investment tax credit for solar energy property is extended, providing a $1,500 credit for each half kilowatt of capacity of solar photovoltaic energy property placed in service during the taxable year. Special rules apply to rehabilitated or subsidized property. A conforming amendment is made to section 48(a)(2)(A)(i) of the Internal Revenue Code, and credits allowed against the Alternative Minimum Tax are amended in section 38(c)(4)(B). The amendments made by this section, effective January 1, 2007, include changes to the investment credit under section 46(2) and apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006. Extension and modification of credit for residential energy efficient property under section 3. Extension and modification of the residential energy efficient property credit under section 3 includes amending the termination date to 2016, removing the 30 percent allowance for solar electric property, and setting a maximum credit of $1,500 per half kilowatt for each taxable year. The maximum credit allowed for qualified solar electric property expenditures is $1,500 per half kilowatt of installed capacity, $2,000 for qualified solar water heating property expenditures, and $500 per half kilowatt of capacity for qualified fuel cell property. The definition of qualified fuel cell property expenditure is amended to include the capacity for which expenditures are made. Additionally, the definitions of qualified solar water heating property expenditure and qualified photovoltaic property expenditure are also modified to include specific criteria. Paragraph (2) of section 25D(d) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include advanced energy storage systems as an integrated component for taxpayers. The credit allowed under subsection (a) for the taxable year shall not exceed the excess of the regular tax liability. The credit allowed under subsection (a) for the taxable year is limited by the regular tax liability and other allowable credits for the year. Carryforward of unused credit is permitted. The tax code allows for the carryforward of unused credits from one taxable year to the next, if the credit exceeds the limitation imposed for that year. Amendments have been made to sections 23 and 24 of the tax code to accommodate this provision. Amendments to the tax code include adding sections 25D and updating sections 25B. These changes apply to expenditures after December 31, 2006. SEC. 4. 3-YEAR ACCELERATED DEPRECIATION PERIOD FOR SOLAR ENERGY PROPERTY AND FUEL CELL PROPERTY. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new clauses regarding property descriptions under section 48(a)(3)(A). The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include new clauses regarding property descriptions under section 48(a)(3)(A), specifically related to wind and solar energy. Amendments are made to section 168(e)(3)(B)(vi)(I) to reflect these changes. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006.
